intro: Stigmaphyllon timoriense, commonly known as the Timor stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
